entry.title: One Puzzle, Two Ways of Puzzling

link.title: One Puzzle, Two Ways of Puzzling

entry.content:
In the form of an experiment, this project investigates how and the degree to which bodily engagement can enhance cognitive performance in a memory-based puzzle. A leading inspiration is one of the central claims within the embodied cognition paradigm, namely that cognitive processing is dependent on physical features of the body so that these are causal or constitutive of the cognitive process itself. Cognitive processing is embodied, extended, embedded, and enacted so that cognition can be understood to exceed beyond the inner workings of the skull.

âœ± Demo video coming soon.

  • Hardware and concept development by Rebecca Rui.
  • Software development by Peng Song.
entry.summary: In the form of an experiment, this project investigates how and the degree to which bodily engagement can enhance cognitive performance in a memory-based puzzle. A leading inspiration is one of the central claims within the embodied cognition paradigm, namely that cognitive processing is dependent on physical features of the body so that these are causal or constitutive of the cognitive process itself. Cognitive processing is embodied, extended, embedded, and enacted so that cognition can be understood to exceed beyond the inner workings of the skull.

entry.title: Architext
entry.content:
Architext is a prototype of a text editor that generates a multi-relational map and a timeline according to the text input. It allows people to construct non-sequential text structures by applying a syntax based on Markdown. It was created for an experiment that involved testing to what extent constructing different visual renditions of content can facilitate text comprehension.

Using the social contract theory as sample content, the video below demonstrates one potential way of organizing information in Architext.

  • In collaboration with Benjamin Turner.
entry.summary: Architext is a prototype of a text editor that generates a multi-relational map and a timeline according to the text input. It allows people to construct non-sequential text structures by applying a syntax based on Markdown. It was created for an experiment that involved testing to what extent constructing different visual renditions of content can facilitate text comprehension.

entry.title: Manufacturinng Habits
entry.content:
One robot creature, one touchscreen device, and one interface are used to reveal how psychological manipulation works on people through design.

  • Shown at the graduation show of The Royal Academy of Art, The Hague, The Netherlands, 2018.
  • Thanks to Thomas Buxo and Agata Jaworska for supporting concept development, Sander de Jong for programming assistance, and John Berthelsen for technical advice.
entry.summary: One robot creature, one touchscreen device, and one interface are used to reveal how psychological manipulation works on people through design.

entry.title: Our Frames
entry.content: An exploration of frames, fragmentation, and the ability to change context with the ease of a gesture.
entry.summary: An exploration of frames, fragmentation, and the ability to change context with the ease of a gesture.

entry.title: Tapijt Boy
entry.content:
Promotional video for Demet Tapijt, a carpet store located on Boekhorststraat in The Hague.

  • In collaboration with Theresa Scherrer and Toni Brell.
  • Starring Jonathan Hielkema.
entry.summary: Promotional video for Demet Tapijt, a carpet store located on Boekhorststraat in The Hague.

entry.title: Bureaucracy Complex
entry.content:
A model of the worldâ€™s effective planetary-scale bureaucratic system currently in place.

  • Inspired by the written work of David Graeber.
  • In collaboration with Taya Reshetnik.
  • Shown at the exhibition Temporary Assembly of Borderless States, Waag Society, Amsterdam 2016.
entry.summary: A model of the worldâ€™s effective planetary-scale bureaucratic system currently in place.

entry.title: Lecture Series Posters
entry.content:
Posters for a lecture series organized by the INSIDE Master Interior Architecture program at The Royal Academy of Art, The Hague.

  • In collaboration with Rudi van Delden (1-3) and Daan Kars (4-5).
entry.summary: Posters for a lecture series organized by the INSIDE Master Interior Architecture program at The Royal Academy of Art, The Hague.

entry.title: Terms and Conditions
entry.content:
This installation makes the process of mandatory updates into the physical experience of walking down a hallway. We often encounter terms and conditions when our software or operating system needs to be updated, and if we do not, it will cease to function. Asking for our consent is to deceive us with the option of choice.

  • Inspired by Miranda July.
entry.summary: This installation makes the process of mandatory updates into the physical experience of walking down a hallway. We often encounter terms and conditions when our software or operating system needs to be updated, and if we do not, it will cease to function. Asking for our consent is to deceive us with the option of choice.

entry.title: OS Archive App
entry.content: A prototype of an Android app for archiving our personal OS histories.
entry.summary: A prototype of an Android app for archiving our personal OS histories.

entry.title: Misbehave: A Browser Extension
entry.content: A browser extension that hides everything the cursor hovers.
entry.summary: A browser extension that hides everything the cursor hovers.
